AMK Companion App 1.1 documentation
AMK Companion App 1.1 documentation
  • Usage
Back to top

app_main module#

Arduino Macro Keyboard Companion App - AMKAPP Ofir Temelman

app_main.ask_for_userinput()#

Manual communication with AMK. Legal input is get function names

app_main.chuncks(lst, n)#

Yield successive n-sized chunks from lst.

app_main.close_serial_at(serial_port)#

Closes serial communication with AMK device at serial_port.

Parameters:

serial_port (serial.Serial object) – The serial port to be closed

app_main.close_window(app_window)#

Closes the GUI window, and informs the AMK Device.

Parameters:

app_window (amk_gui.MainFrame object.) – The window to close.

app_main.current_serial_port()#

Finds the current active device by looking for an open serial port.

Returns:

The active port, if there is one, or None

Return type:

serial.Serial object, or None

app_main.exception_hook(exc_type, exc_value, exc_traceback)#

Log exceptions instead of print to console

app_main.get_active_set()#

Asks AMK device for it’s active set data over serial. Expects an answer

app_main.get_bindings()#

Asks AMK device for it’s key binding data over serial. Expects an answer

app_main.get_keypad()#

Asks AMK device for all of it’s data over serial. Expects an answer

app_main.get_layout()#

Asks AMK device for it’s layout data over serial. Expects an answer

app_main.get_name()#

Asks AMK device for it’s name over serial. Expects an answer

app_main.get_orientation()#

Asks AMK device for it’s orientation data over serial. Expects an answer

app_main.grid_hide(widget)#
app_main.grid_show(widget)#
app_main.list_comports(keyword='arduino')#

Lists active COM ports on the computer with ‘arduino’ in their name.

Parameters:

keyword – A sub-string to look for in port descriptions. set to ‘’ to allow all strings.

Returns:

List of COM ports

app_main.list_serial_ports()#

Initializes available serial ports, and returns them in a list.

Parameters:

comports – A list of available COM ports.

Returns:

a list of serial ports

Return type:

list of serial.Serial objects

app_main.list_to_bytearray(lst)#

Converts a 2d list of key bindings into a bytestring to send over serial.

Parameters:

lst – Payload to parse.

Returns:

active set’s index.

app_main.open_serial_at(comport_name)#

starts serial communication at the port with the given name.

Parameters:

comport_name – The name of the target port. e.g. ‘COM4’

Returns:

The port that has been opened

Return type:

serial.Serial object

app_main.open_window()#

Opens the app GUI window

app_main.parse_active_set(content)#

Converts a message payload containing active set to it’s index.

Parameters:

content – Payload to parse.

Returns:

active set’s index.

app_main.parse_binding(target, content)#

Converts a 1d list of key bindings into a 2d list with dimensions of target.

Parameters:

  • target – AMK object, whose keypad dimensions we want to use.

  • content – Payload to parse.

Returns:

Key bindings matrix.

Return type:

List[List[int]]

app_main.parse_layout(content)#

Converts a message payload containing layout to a list of values.

Parameters:

content – Payload to parse.

Returns:

list of layout values.

app_main.parse_message(message, target_amk)#

Converts a multi-line message from AMK device according to the protocol, and inserts it to the specified AMK object.

Parameters:

message – Message to parse. Can be multi-line.

app_main.parse_orientation(content)#

Converts a message payload containing orientation to it’s value.

Parameters:

content – Payload to parse.

Returns:

orientation value.

app_main.parse_string(content)#

Converts a message payload containing string to a python string.

Parameters:

content (bytestring) – Payload to parse.

Returns:

Decoded str in utf-8.

app_main.save_to_arduino(amk_data: dict, amk)#
app_main.send_bindings(bindings, amk)#

Sends the given key bindings to AMK device to update.

Parameters:

  • bindings – Key binding data.

  • amk – amk.AMK object to recieve reply.

app_main.switch_device_to(comport_name)#

Switches active device to device at COM port comport_name.

This function closes the active connection, if it exists, updates the global AMK object, and updates it with the new AMK device’s data

Parameters:

comport_name – The name of the port to activate

app_main.update_device_list(app_window, period=3000)#

Refreshes the devices list on the gui. Happens every <period> seconds

app_main.wait_for_arduino(num_tries=3, delay=0.5)#

Tells the AMK device to get ready for communication, and waits for a reply

Parameters:

  • num_tries – The number of time to try the handshake.

  • delay – Time to wait between tries.

app_main.write_readlines(message)#

Writes a message on serial, expecting an anwser. Reads multiple lines, if available.

Parameters:

message – A message to AMK in the specified protocol.

Returns:

The reply from AMK device
